column2: Artisanal Fisheries Development Program
column3: The general objective of the project is to improve the income of small fishers in three southern regions of Haiti (South, South-East and Grande Anse), through the sustainable development of artisanal fisheries. The specific objectives are to: (i) strengthen the institutional management of the fisheries sector for resource sustainability, and improved sanitary and food safety conditions for marketing of seafood products; (ii) improve the quality of fish at landing sites, through improved public infrastructure; and (iii) increase artisanal fisheries productivity and reduce economic losses through the establishment of a rights-based fishery management scheme. column2: Impact Enterprises: Supporting Local Agricultural Value Chains in Colombia and E
column3: This project will build on the Clinton Foundation/Clinton Giustra Enterprise Partnership (CGEP) experience with creating for-profit impact enterprises that address gaps in agricultural supply chains that have the potential of connecting vulnerable communities with markets. These impact enterprises reconfigure fragmented local supply chains by building local production capacity, integrating logistics, and becoming the trusted broker between producers and purchasers. column2: FONTAGRO’s 2016 Photo Contest: “In a New Light: Family Farming in Latin America, the Caribbean, and Spain”
column3:
FONTAGRO's 2016 Photo Contest "In a New Light: Family Farming in Latin America, the Caribbean, and Spain" (the "Contest") begun on February 18, 2016, and ended on March 31, 2016, at 12:00 PM United States Eastern Time. The categories were:
 1- People: small farmers and their families (including faces, half body or full body, etc.)
 2 - Places: photographs that showcase breathtaking agricultural landscapes in Latin America, the Caribbean, and Spain.
 3- Agriculture in Action: including cattle, crops, plantations, agricultural activities (such as planting, production, and harvesting), processing, marketing, markets, use of technology, etc.
 4- FONTAGRO Projects:1 photographs that showcase FONTAGRO projects that have been completed or are in the implementation phase, or that highlight areas of impact of said projects.
 The winner in each category will receive a $1,000 cash prize. Winning photographs will be part of the permanent photo gallery that can be showcased in FONTAGRO's website and websites of authorized parties, as well as in FONTAGRO's printed materials. Photographs that are chosen as finalists will also be part of an ad hoc publication.

column2: Peruvian Amazon Chestnut for the World
column3: The solution is an opportunity for the IDB Lab to contribute to the chestnut sector in Peru at a critical moment that will change the direction of exports in the future.
